content: The cost applicable to sales for the first 9 months of 2022 were as follows: for gold, USD 1,126 per ounce, which is 8% lower than a year ago; for silver, USD 17.65 per ounce, which is 10% lower than a year ago; for lead, USD 1,282 per metric ton, which is 12% lower than a year ago; for copper, USD 6,675 per metric ton, which is 6% higher in comparison to a year ago; and finally, in the case of zinc, the cost applicable to sales was for USD 3,037 per metric ton, which is 43% higher than a year ago.
